website_summaries.verdict: Fast setup and rugged construction at a price point that may have some users buying more than one to hold multiple saws.
pros: Robust and rugged enough to hold a heavy miter saw
Saw brackets move smoothly along rails when in operation
cons: Extension arms cannot hold much weight

customer_reviews.title: bad welding
customer_reviews.text: The setup of this product is not bad but had it only 10 months with light duty and welds are already breaking on it. Update: Affinity Tools has replaced this stand. Their customer service has been very professional and I would deal with them again.
customer_reviews.author: E. A. C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy, couldn't be happier!!!
customer_reviews.text: Mounted a 10" makita compound slider (LS1016L). I realize mounting a high-end $600 saw on an $80 mount isn't the most ideal way to operate. But the fact of the matter is, it works great!! This value is really unbeatable! Value = quality+price. This being (not the best) excellent quality and incredibly low price, its value makes it a 5 STAR BUY! I've been a carpenter for 15yrs and I would absolutely recommend this product to coworkers, general contractors, really anyone with the need for a stand like this, I would recommend buying this one! Excellent buy, couldn't be happier!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Skaggs, Billings, MT.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Good construction. Very sturdy when set up and a perfect height for a 6’ person. Adequate hardware for mounting. Has wings to mount your saw if the holes are offset. Saw mount has rubber feet and releases easily to remove saw from stand for storage. The one thing I don’t like is the way the set screws angle in from the tubing to lock the extensions causing the extensions to tilt slightly. I understand why as the square tubing is light weight. This is not enough for me to lower my rating as this is a nice stand and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mpg

customer_reviews.title: Works the best and the best value I've seen.
customer_reviews.text: After buying a Husky work table and a Ryobi stand that were both supposed to fit "most Mitre saw brands up to 12" " and having neither fit my 12" Rigid saw, I ordered this. It fits, it seems well built and sturdier and was less expensive than the other like items. Thought I've set up but not used the saw yet I'm confident this is the best value that I've found. I wanted to post this in hopes that it might save a few trips and returns for a few people.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty piece of gear
customer_reviews.text: This is a very substantial stand....well made, heavy duty. Well priced. Heavier than expected, so its a bit cumbersome to wield around. The releases and hinges were very stiff out of the box, making it difficult to open and close. Maybe that will loosen up with some use. Overall, very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Navy Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: I got mine on sale but after using the table I would have paid full price, I like how fast it assembled, very easy to move around, very sturdy unit
customer_reviews.author: Dave Spangler

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value!
customer_reviews.text: Very solid stand for the price. Easy to assemble, very sturdy. Arrived in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: wolf359

customer_reviews.title: BANG FOR the BUCK and good quality
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a great stand. Had to use my own screws and bolts to get the Festool on the base but I cannot complain. I love the sturdiness. Will update in the future but once again for the price on amazon I cannot be happier as it’s a 3rd of the price of some other stuff out there.
customer_reviews.author: D0m

customer_reviews.title: Saved SOO much with this brand!
customer_reviews.text: So I found it on a "deal" and told my husband as he was JUST saying he needed one the other day. Here comes this arriving. Awesome timing as my older son was just starting a project where he needed our saw. The ease of set up and take down with this stand was amazing! It was easy to move, set up the saw and take down (per my 15 year old). My grandpa, who used to do this for a living, was actually impressed with the saw stand as well and said he wishes this was around when he would travel to clients homes! Can't get any better review than an 83 year old former contractor!
customer_reviews.author: VaidyaFamily

customer_reviews.title: Great mobile saw stand, would buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: Very solid for the size. Piece of cake to fold up and transport. I use a DeWalt DWS715 with the stand. A little tricky to get the mounting bolts attached, but only added a few minutes. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JKM

customer_reviews.title: Main supports out of alignment, rendering the precision of a mitre saw moot- waste of time/money.
customer_reviews.text: Support outriggers not aligned with saw once installed, totally out of square. Emailed company pics, a couple back and forth, "their engineers determined the supports weren't square" (which they are. actually) they sent new supports (not powder coated/painted- totally lame), same exact issue; turns out the main tubes are out of alignment. I "adjusted" them by having to bend the metal tubes closer to square, but overall am disappointed in the hassle and wasted time on this purchase. Will purchase a nice, alternate brand/model and keep this as a back-up- does not look professional when your tools are all crooked and misaligned, put together poorly, so will NOT be taking this to job sites.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: High quality. Low price.
customer_reviews.text: This saw table may be the best purchase I have ever made on Amazon. It worked with our 12" Ryobi miter saw. Super easy to set up and feels very durable. This is going to make our DIY jobs sooo much easier. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: Grrat value for quality and portability.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a portable stand for my 7" miter. It is more sturdy than it looks, holds wide planks, and heavier than I had thought. It folds well but arms stick out a bit; no big deal to remove for transport. Only complaint is if you tilt stand to 90-degrees the saw will slide as clamps are not as tight as traditional clamps. But overall, I'm happy with value and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Khoa H.

customer_reviews.title: Well made miter saw stand
customer_reviews.text: This product is extremely well made with thick steel(for a portable stand) and nice welds. It was extremely easy to put together and has great extensions to help support long board. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone that is in the market.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Spear

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control on the welds
customer_reviews.text: Item was strong and might have been great if I would have been able to use it, but one of the welds was not quality checked and I could not insert the extension arm into the slot, rendering the item useless to me, had to repackage and send back item! Now I'm afraid to buy another one...
customer_reviews.author: denise wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Not a great stand. Pass on this. Get a better one.
customer_reviews.text: One leg came bent, another won't snap open well and won't lock open. Saw stand is still usable but I'm keeping my eye on it in case it collapses. Legs don't have any ability to extend or level, so the stand wobbles on uneven flooring unless you put chips of wood under some legs. Shouldn't be that way for a brand new item. Not impressed with it. Wouldn't recommend buying it. You can buy better mitre stands. Think I will.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: A great mitersaw stand
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this miter saw stand to mount my 10" Metabo to. It was a breeze setting it up and aligning my miter saw. It is easily transported and when setup it is study and stable. I love the fact that it folds up takes minimum space up in my storage building. The one fault I did find in it, is that the tightening screw for the arms that hold the round support attachment to is in the corner of the square tube. This means to store it vertical you have to remove the tightening screw or risk breaking the tri-knob. No big deal, just would be easier to store though and doesn't deter usage.
customer_reviews.author: Harley R.

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need it to do
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this does what I need it to: 1. Raise my miter saw up to working height 2. Support long sections of material Pros: - Good price - Easy on/off clip system for miter saw - Folds up nicely Cons: - Extension arms twist all over when tightened down. Takes work to keeps square with saw base
customer_reviews.author: JoeCool

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to put up and appears very sturdy. I can't imagine a better deal out there. I'm confident this will last me and do me well for all the needs I have moving forward. Looks great too. Only issue at all is that the bolts to attach the miter base could be about 1/8 inch longer. Couldn't use both washers on the front, only on the rear because the bolts were a tiny bit too short.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Very nice saw stand for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on some non-Amazon reviews. I have used it on and off for several months of DIY homeowner use and am very pleased with it in general. It is very sturdy, sets up and folds up quickly. The only small issue I have with it is that the extension supports do tend to twist a bit when something heavy is placed on them. I found that I could not depend on them staying level with the saw bed when cutting long pieces of baseboard or crown molding. Instead I had to use an independent support. Other than that I really like this table and the price is great.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Great Miter Saw Stand
customer_reviews.text: The stand is constructed well and priced right. Seems to be very heavy duty. It holds my Makita LS0815F Miter saw without having to use any additional brackets. I tried it out over the weekend and it's solid. The extended rails worked well in holding my lumber while cutting. I would definitely buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: B. Hashimoto

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Well Built.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10" miter saw and I am so glad that I passed buying a more expensive that they had at the home improvement store. It is heavy enough to make the platform stable, but folds up and is easy move around in my garage for storage. I don't have enough room to keep it set up all the time and this thing is perfect. Really impressed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hawley

customer_reviews.title: Really a 4 1/2 stars
customer_reviews.text: There's really not much you have to do to assemble: pull the legs down, insert the extensions and riser. The "hardest" part is attaching the mounting bars to the saw. The instructions call for a 5" bolt, but the shorter bolts work well for the Dewalt miter saw. Once installed, carry the saw to the stand, clamp the mounting bars to the stand, plug in the saw and go to town. Total time to assemble at the site would be less than a minute if you've got the saw near the stand.
customer_reviews.author: William LAmoreaux

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly heavy duty!
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly pleased with this purchase. I like it better than ones at Home Depot and Lowe’s that cost 2-3 times as much. Don’t hesitate, just get it. Thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew 7.62

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and adjustable for most miter saw bases
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my new miter saw and I could not be happier. It was quick to set up, adjustable for many different saw base configurations and the supports on each end of the base expand out to meet just about all of your requirements for most trim lengths that you may be working with. Without this base it would have been more difficult to do a lot of the trim pieces that I used for my recent kitchen remodel. Highly recommend, sturdy, well constructed and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J. Coplin SR

customer_reviews.title: Good price. Nice fit and finish. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t actually put it to the test yet, but I can’t find any faults with it so far. Fit and finish is very good. It requires a minimal amount of assembly with one wrench. Ideally your saw should mount with four bolts but with my older Delta saw the two rear bolts are closer together and can’t be secured to the brackets. But this doesn’t affect the usability or stability of the saw on the stand. The price was good and shipping from Amazon was quick.
customer_reviews.author: Stude

customer_reviews.title: Stable, easy to use, versatile
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I’d never had one but I got it when I installed new laminate floors and it was a huge timesaver for me. Set up is easy, folds out to make a long, stable platform but folds up to take minimal space in my garage. I bought some optional wheels thing that would make it easier to move around in the garage but either I’m using them wrong or they just don’t work well, but the table itself is great, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: HappinessIsAWarmJackRussell

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the price. Even though I am a contractor, there are few occasions when I will actually use it. I read many of the reviews here, and I agree with most of them. The welds and alignment aren't perfect, but you always have to check your alignment anyway. You also need to consider the height at which you want to work. Some people think these are not high enough. All in all a good value
customer_reviews.author: Twee

customer_reviews.title: Ok product
customer_reviews.text: I like the way the saw is easily removed from the stand but that’s it. The extension arms are set up kind of cheap and don’t sit straight and it doesn’t have wheels so moving it around is awkward. I wish I bought one with wheels on the base and rollers on the extension arms
customer_reviews.author: aargiro

customer_reviews.title: It's fine, but the extensions sag and twist the wood
customer_reviews.text: It's serving the purpose, but the extension bars that hold the longer pieces of wood sag quite a bit, and tend to twist the wood so that it's uneven at the point where it hits the blade. You can press down on the wood to get it flat, but it's not ideal. Also, the plastic caps that go in the ends of the metal tubes keep falling out. Overall, it seems ok for the price, but not the most substantial stand out there.
customer_reviews.author: flinger

customer_reviews.title: This possibly the best Miter Saw Stand For The money
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent Miter Saw Stand, Wide Stance, Well built with 9’ Of working surface
customer_reviews.author: Tom Horsman

customer_reviews.title: Good stand for home workman
customer_reviews.text: Dewalt 12 inch compound miter fits securely. Stand is sturdy with no shimming or wobble. Outriggers extend easily and hold their setting. Height is comfortable for average adult. Not hasd the stand long enough to determine if it will loosen with use. No obvious fasteners or fits which would be susceptible to fatigue. Not using a sliding miter so no experience if pulling weight os saw forward would tend to tip stand. Based on the girth of leg spread, I don’t expect this tendency to occur.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY STURDY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this, concurrent, with a mitre table saw. This was MUCH BETTER made, alas, than the saw which I attached to it. It was very easy to assemble, and offers a good deal of flexibility, as to size of materials to be cut. The clamps, on the saw, attach firmly. It is doesn't wiggle, when the saw is in use. I would, definitely, buy this, again.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID P FROST

customer_reviews.title: Welded joint came off.
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply built product. The outtriger extension arm came off the day I unpacked the device. it was a poorly welded joint. I wrote to affinity tools and they promptly created an incident ticket and shipped me replacement parts. I got the part today and realize they have shipped me the wrong part. After 2 weeks I still don't have a working stand. This is supposed to be a "heavy duty" miter saw stand. Imagine if the welded joint would have come off while the saw was in use!! I do not recommend buying this product. Amazon keeps peddling cheap products under "Amazon choice" label.
customer_reviews.author: Rastapopoulos

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a very good portable miter saw stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a very affordable and sturdy portable miter saw stand. It was very easy to assemble, and it folds and unfolds easily for storage. It extends out to 10' with the outriggers, and has no problem stabilizing long boards for delicate cuts. I highly recommend this saw stand. I just finished installing about 400 square feet of tongue and groove which I cut using this stand and my miter saw. Great price and great product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy & portable.
customer_reviews.text: Solidly built, keeps the miter saw & work station very stable & safe to use, plus it folds flat for easy storage; the removable cross-arm saw holders come with brackets for adapting to saws without straight-line holes, plus it grips firmly to the stand & yet they can easily be removed along with the saw; this by far was my best choice with a very reasonable price to boot.
customer_reviews.author: MiLeToP

customer_reviews.title: Great Product....except....
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy to assemble for the most part! The only issue is moving it around with saw attached. Does not come with wheels which is the only reason why it gets 4 stars. Finding wheels that fit the holes on the legs is next to impossible so it's very heavy and difficult to move around unless you take the saw off, which if you use it often can be a pain as well. Overall great product though!
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me
customer_reviews.text: This has been very useful for me and a great upgrade for my cheap miter saw. The stand is reasonably lightweight but still very sturdy with the saw attached. With the “rails” attached to the bottom of the saw, it can still be used on the ground or on a work table, which is nice. Be careful folding the legs of the stand; it’s pretty easy to get a finger pinched. Otherwise, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Overall it works well as a stand for my miter saw . Each leg fold individually and the extensions slide most of the way in. Would be nice if it had wheels or sat level when folded. Miter mounts easily enough though I wish it locked a little more secure so I could leave it on when folded but it slides to one end when you tip it up. Overall not a bad stand for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Unverzagt

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: When I folded out the legs, the unit would wobble and did not stand flush to the ground. On closer inspection, as you can see in the photo, the fame is warped, with one corner lifting off the ground as the unit lays flat and folded. There was no damage to the packaging - the unit was shipped this way. Absolutely piece of garbage and a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say here. Easily connected my chop saw and it mounts on good. Had to do a little adjusting front to tear to level it up so it wasnt tipsy when opening and closing saw. Seems sturdy and happy so far!
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: SUPERB STAND
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised. It is very easy to put together; and more importantly it fits my Dewalt DW 715 miter saw like a glove. It is somewhat lightweight; but very strong and steady. I am now considering adding the wheel kit. I am extremely satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: F. Olivera

customer_reviews.title: Good value and utility
customer_reviews.text: I used this stand to support a Dewalt chop saw. I've just completed a sizeable deck expansion using the saw and stand. The stand has turned out to be very useful, holding everything from 2 x 2 decorative pieces to 2 x 10 stringers. It works well with the Dewalt saw. Its adjustability makes accurate cutting a snap. This stand will be in my garage for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband needed a stand for his Hitachi miter saw and we had been looking around at the big box stores for one but they were all expensive (and didn't have great reviews -I look them up before we buy things like that). Then I came across this one! Let me tell you, this thing is great! His miter saw fits just fine and it is very stable when he uses it for cutting no matter what size wood. We've had no issues with it at all. Highly reccomend this stand.
customer_reviews.author: Night Nurse

customer_reviews.title: My first amazon review, because I’m that happy
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this stand. For the price you cannot beat it. I’ve only used a professional style dewalt stand before this, and I still loved this product for my house. It doesn’t have wheels, but it is simple to fold and very light. The clamp system with the saw is great, you can put it on and take it off in 2 seconds. It took maybe 5 minutes for me to set this stand up out of the box with my new miter saw. I highly recommend this for the common DIY people and even people who might expand from that.
customer_reviews.author: SD Fire

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable price, convenient clamp-on rails
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdy and was easy to assemble. The stand is well thought and will fit most of the benchtop tools. Priced reasonably, compared to the bigger brands. Note: I am not using extendable supports, hence no opinion on this part. Now I am contemplating to get an extra one for the sake of those top rails (orange) that are bolted to the saw and clamp on top of the main frame (dark grey) - to be able to swap miter saw and sander in a moment..
customer_reviews.author: Serge

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I like the portability and the stow-ability is important as well. My 12" compound miter saw usually resides in a permanent spot on non-movable work surface, and it is really nice now having the means to position the saw closer to where needed. The PM-4000 is well-made, glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Phipps

customer_reviews.title: A little difficult to assemble, but a good stand overall
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with the stand, and I think it is essential to achieve proper use of your miter saw. My only complaint is that this thing was a pain to assemble! The bolts were a real pain to get lined up in my Hitachi C10FCE2. It did eventually fit, but it was difficult. Also, the quick-release mechanism isn't perfect. At first I didn't think I was going to be able to lock it down on the rails. However, after I realized how hard you have to push down, I was able to attach it. Despite these drawbacks, it's a decent stand and I'm happy to have it.
customer_reviews.author: K. O'Meara

customer_reviews.title: It wobbles on flat surfaces
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be built well, although it isn't quite as easy to work with as it seemed in the video. But the really annoying part is that it wobbles on flat surfaces. It was fine on slightly uneven ground but in my garage it feels unsteady. It doesn't inspire confidence when you have a machine with a spinning blade on it and it wobbles. I guess I got one that isn't quite up to tolerance.
customer_reviews.author: Joe K.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value for money
customer_reviews.text: Awesome value for money. This sturdy stand features excellent material and build quality and accommodated my 10" Delta miter saw perfectly. Reasonably portable with saw mounted and very stable when setup, with nice wide extensions allowing me to layout 16" boards with relative ease. I am able lift it with saw mounted and move it to where I am working and set it up without help. You shouldn't have a miter saw without one of these. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Eaton Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Better construction than I expected for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Better construction than I expected for the price. Paint is only fair but pretty was not my goal. Too heavy for some but clearly designed for heavy duty use. I am a Boy Scout volunteer who intends to use this for camp projects. Perfect for my intended use. Perhaps not for someone who wants a light stand to move around a lot.
customer_reviews.author: William P. Carlucci

customer_reviews.title: Super steady and strong
customer_reviews.text: Great for moving saw around the garage but also for putting in the truck for the job site. Folds out quickly and easily. The side braces slide out/in easily and they tighten down securely. Overall for the price I couldn’t have asked for a better product. Weird color scheme but oh well.
customer_reviews.author: JPH

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. The height is one thing I was impressed with. Most others had shorter height and since I'm 6'2" wanted something that works for me. The construction seems solid, yet overall weight is easy to deal with. Setting up my miter saw was very easy, really like the ease of that, and the quick clamps are awesome. Came with all bolts I needed and then some Was very impressed at how easy it breaks back down, folds up, easy to store. Highly recommend it! Oh ya, and I have other plans for it, versatile design.
customer_reviews.author: brize

customer_reviews.title: Portable and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I used it to mount my Dewalt miter saw. Easy to put to assemble, portable and takes very less space and not very pricey. Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Swami

customer_reviews.title: must have stand for a miter saw
customer_reviews.text: After years of getting by with just setting my miter saw on what ever was available, I needed something more stable to handle cutting a large amount of lumbar. This is easy to set up, stores away quickly and is very sturdy, great value for the price
customer_reviews.author: Vic & Paula

customer_reviews.title: This is a big step up from nothing
customer_reviews.text: I like that it is foldable and that you can quickly attach and detach the saw. My main complaint is that the bars that support the lumber are not precise enough to really keep it flat. I was hoping this would help me to cut big long pieces of wood (like 2x12s) precisely and its not really enough for that.
customer_reviews.author: A. Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Took about fifteen minutes to put it together and make a first cut on my saw. Huge help while handling deck boards by myself.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Giarrusso

customer_reviews.title: Good product for price
customer_reviews.text: Worked well with my DeWalt Mitter Saw. Easy to put together; well made; easy to carry; and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: H. B.

customer_reviews.title: Back and knees savior
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy stand. First one for me so none to compare. I had to use the provided adapters to mount my black and decker. Even with the adapters , I couldn't get mounts squared on the saw but it doesn't affect mounting on the stand. No more working on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Ordered to hold a Hitachi C10FCE2 miter saw. No issue mounting saw to stand as all necessary hardware was included. Don't understand why some say you must first mount saw to plywood. Clamping system stays bolted to saw so it's easy on easy off for setup or transport. Don't think will put wheels on stand as would rather make two trips than drag setup through dirt and mud. As usual brown truck delivery beat the box up but not enough to loose anything from inside.
customer_reviews.author: jet2

customer_reviews.title: Great stand for my home shop
customer_reviews.text: This stand is sturdy and easy to set up. The included mounting brackets make it simple to attach any miter saw to the quick attach mounts regardless of attachment bolt pattern on your saw. The extendable support arms are simple to operate and great for cutting longer materials. The quick attach mounts are nice for simple removal of your miter saw when needed. Gave 4-stars simply because it'd be nice if wheels came standard with the stand. The wheel set available for this stand seem overpriced for a basic wheel set.
customer_reviews.author: Andy R

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistency & missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Don’t get me wrong it’s nice. I’m just super disappointed in the inconsistency. I only received 3 out of the 4 (K) 3 point knobs that secures 4 sliding aspects of this product in first pair of pictures. I also noticed finish caps on one of the two (E) support “T”s seen in second pair pictures. Finally one out of the four finish caps for the legs on the stand were installed wrong, this last one is the least of my concern. What my biggest problem with this is the missing parts, if parts are shipped I will gladly change this rating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great budget stand for large saws
customer_reviews.text: Handles a 12 inch sliding Dewalt saw with no problems. Easy to set up. Easy to break down. Very stable and easy to move around. Getting the level right on the extending arms takes a bit of fiddling, but an awesome stand for a large saw at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light but strong and stable
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised, great design and easy to use and transport, and stable when up. Some reviews mentioned the welds, but mine look solid, and even at worst, easy to fix with a mig gun. Again, I'm really pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Ron R.

customer_reviews.title: a contractor may have different requirements but once you take the saw off with the quick mounts the stand folds up easily. The outriggers are very helpful for long stock
customer_reviews.text: After looking at quite a few of these miter saw workstations I believe this is a bargain. I am a DIY, a contractor may have different requirements but once you take the saw off with the quick mounts the stand folds up easily. The outriggers are very helpful for long stock.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: The extension arms slide out easily and the saw moves along the rails on the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted. I have a smaller sliding compound saw and mounting it on the mounting brackets was a little bit of a chore because of the odd size of the saw, but not a big deal. The extension arms slide out easily and the saw moves along the rails on the mounting brackets easily. Made cutting a breeze and reduced splintering wood since the pieces no longer fall off after the cut is made. It is good quality and except for the mounting brackets, sets up in a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: DFarkas

customer_reviews.title: Works great for weekend projects
customer_reviews.text: I assembled this in about 20 minutes. The instructions say use the shorter bolts and don’t even mention the larger ones. I had to use the large ones with my install. It worked perfectly and is easy to store away.
customer_reviews.author: The beard of knowledge

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I really like it. Easy to set up. Stable but not too heavy. I'm not a pro, just a busy home owner. So I can't speak to really heavy usage. But this thing is excellent. Well built
customer_reviews.author: W. Vinci

customer_reviews.title: Supports my 12" slider , with no problems.
customer_reviews.text: Having rollers on the support members might have been nice, but, I'm very pleased with this product. It sets up, and breaks down very easily. Supports my 12" slider , with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: vince

customer_reviews.title: Cheap stand that does what it's suppose to for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought one with wheels. The arms can't handle too much weight when extended, but aren't too difficult to adjust. It's a cheap stand and is not for the wood shop. It would work fine for trim, molding and 2x4s. Spend a second adjusting the arms to your liking and then go for it. Best for leaving on a jobsite and taking your saw home with you. I am going to try to figure out how to put some wheels on it so I can move it around easier. The ease of taking your saw off is nice, but it will take two people to move this if your saw is on the stand.
customer_reviews.author: David Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Not Pure Garbage, but close.
customer_reviews.text: Had to shave off the plastic clips to fit my 12” Hitachi saw. Still doesn’t fit all that great even with the adapters. One extension is fine the other is flimsy. I only bought this to cut 5”x5” timbers for a retaining wall, and needed the saw close to the project site. I should of spent more money and got a better stand.
customer_reviews.author: Rich 777

customer_reviews.title: You need one
customer_reviews.text: This stand is sturdy, parts are coated or painted, easy to assemble and adjust and holds a heavy miter saw very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: great deal on a great table.
customer_reviews.text: sure I could have built my own miter table. But when space is a consideration, I.E. it needs to fold up easy for storage its hard to go wrong with this table. Assembly is a piece of cake, holds my hitachi miter saw like a champ, support bars are very adjustable and high quality. I would buy this again and not even flinch.
customer_reviews.author: Pacific NorthWest

customer_reviews.title: Big time manufacturing issue on this Item
customer_reviews.text: Got the first one and one of the locks on the leg was broken. No big deal. Ordered another and the same leg and pin was broken. Luckily, I still had not sent back the original one so I was able to take a leg from it and place it on the second one. Between the 2, I was able to make 1. Good luck if ordering.
customer_reviews.author: David Hall

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to take the saw off
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction, shipped almost ready to go out of the box. 3 or 4 minor steps and I had the stand set up and the saw mounted. Very easy to take the saw off, fold the stand, and store for next time. Sturdy enough for casual/moderate DIY use, small enough to fit in the back of a hatchback. Nice product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Mac

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I received this afternoon and had it assembled in under 15 minutes. Seems to be plenty sturdy, and am looking forward to using it - I've wanted one for a long time! Hardest part of the whole assembly was lifting the saw onto the stand; not bad for this 61 year old grandma!
customer_reviews.author: Jean Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great buy at this price point
customer_reviews.text: This a well built stand for your miter saw. Don't let the low price fool you, this is a quality product that is very steady and will last. The least steady part of the unit seems to be the extensions for your lumber but they are more than adequate for the job. Great buy at this price point. I looked at two big box stores and by far this unit beats anything I saw in both price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: John Cotton

customer_reviews.title: Great stand... Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my hubby and he loves it, says this is going to help him so much... He won't have to be making anymore make shift stands... As he will be renovating our home.
customer_reviews.author: Will & Ace

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Just unpackaged and was blown away by the quality of this stand for the price.. Seems like Bora should be charging 2-3 times more for this stand. Great looking with super easy directions. Out of the box and all set up in less that 30 mins. Great product out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: EDB

customer_reviews.title: Easy and portable
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my saw. Makes the job much easier. Light enough to move by myself.
customer_reviews.author: ifsogirl

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought I was buying
customer_reviews.text: When I used the quick attach bracelets, the saw was very unstable. Only 2 brackets were supplied, 4 were needed. I called customer service, it took several calls to get to talk to someone, they were very little help. I ended up rigging the stand with plywood straps and semi permanently attaching the saw.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Wing

customer_reviews.title: BORA Portamate PM-4000 - Heavy Duty Folding Miter Saw Stand with Quick Attach Tool Mounting Bars
customer_reviews.text: I saved a lot of money buying this for an old saw. I was tired of lifting my old saw or kneeling to cut. I was going to buy a new saw but this has given a perfectly good old saw new life.
customer_reviews.author: NashDBelle

customer_reviews.title: Nice stand for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Well built stand the only issue I foresee is possibly the hold down tabs for the saw are plastic as shown in the pic. Kinda wish the metal part of the saw hold down wrapped around the stand.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN

customer_reviews.title: This table is perfect
customer_reviews.text: The box is solid but not too heavy to be lifted by a woman. It was super easy to assemble. You only need to attach a few arms, knobs and brackets for the miter saw and voila! It took me maybe 20 minutes to put together. The miter saw is now at a perfect height. I'm 5'4" and my husband is 6'2" and the table is at a comfortable level for both of us. I especially appreciate the side arms that hold the baseboards in place instead of having to have someone standing there holding it so it doesn't move. The table is made of strong and sturdy materials.
customer_reviews.author: nessa007

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Really solid product. This is way better than using a miter saw on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Chad in MN

customer_reviews.title: Good for light use.
customer_reviews.text: It's fine, you get what you pay for. A hell of a lot better than kneeling on the floor. I would buy it again, but only in current situation, finishing a house that I bought and never using it again. If I was still building commercially, hard no. The adjustments which I will never adjust are VERY cheesy and cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Devilmanak

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my dewalt saw
customer_reviews.text: Good sturdy stand. I use it with DEWALT DW713 10 in. Portable Compound Miter Saw
customer_reviews.author: Igor

customer_reviews.title: very good price
customer_reviews.text: This has been working very well and takes up little room when stored-
customer_reviews.author: Trinity

customer_reviews.title: good materials, a bit difficult to setup well
customer_reviews.text: Great build quality. Very solid feel. I haven't used it as a portable stand, so I can't speak to how easy it is to fold down and move. It is pretty big and heavy, so I would assume its gonna be a bit of a pain. The side supports are very difficult to get level and accurate to the surface of my chop saw. Customer service is fantastic. My first stand came in without the side supports and HTC sent me a full new stand.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Solid Performer -- Five-Star Value
customer_reviews.text: Finally found a stand for my 10-inch miter saw that did not cost more than the saw itself. After putting it all together, the saw sits perfectly on it, and the whole setup is very stable. Just about when starting the first cut, your thought is likely to be like mine, "I should have gotten this a long time ago."
customer_reviews.author: Lajos P.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected for the price
customer_reviews.text: Husband bought this & seems pleased though he hasn't actually used the miter box to build anything yet!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value, dependable, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Hard to go wrong with this one... the only thing that could be improved for me is to make the clamping system in the front not rear. It’s hard to remove the tool and switch with another.
customer_reviews.author: Some random IT guy

customer_reviews.title: Going to buy a second one for the shop.
customer_reviews.text: Received it yesterday and immediately put it together and tested it out. So far I am very pleased. The saw mount fits tight on stand, allowing for smooth transition of angle and bevel adjustments. Was able to place 14’ pieces of door casing on with the extension arms fully extended. Made a small project effortless and easy. I would recommend this product, and will buy another for my shop. When folded up for storage, it takes up little room and can be easily tucked away.
customer_reviews.author: Pluviophile1230

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: The metal strips easily when trying to secure bolts - had to waste a couple of hours trying to making adjustments to try and make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Ibeerian

customer_reviews.title: Miter Box Stand
customer_reviews.text: The stand is very sturdy and well built. It makes a stable platform for my miter box. It's a great stand if you are not looking for something mobile. It's ok with the wheel kit. The stand for the price is a great.
customer_reviews.author: Carl J. Kulow

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money ! It is hefty and solid !
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had wheels to make it easier to maneuver but one day I will buy a set .
customer_reviews.author: Tired of the lies

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Light, portable, affordable. perfect for my small makita battery miter saw. I like my DeWalt miter stand but it's just too big and bulky. I can keep my saw attached to this stand and carry it in and out of my truck daily as one piece.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Good stand but rubber feet on the attached the the saw holder fell out with very little use
customer_reviews.text: I like the saw stand for its basic use but two of the rubber feet that would rest on a table if not being used on the stand fell out with very little use. Now I cant use it on a bench table without it leaning. So far I've contacted customer service but only got a answering machine.
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: Nice stand
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it once but it seems to be a decent stand.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Mesick

customer_reviews.title: Great solid and sturdy miter saw stand for the price.  Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Great product.....Seems well made and sturdy, especially for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: BigA

product_meta.title: BORA Portamate PM-4000 - Heavy Duty Folding Miter Saw Stand with Quick Attach Tool Mounting Bars
product_meta.description:
Item Package Quantity:1If you have a miter saw, then the PM-4000 folding miter saw stand is exactly what you need. Designed to work with nearly every make and model miter saw or chop saw, this strong, stable stand will allow you to setup wherever you wish – quickly, easily, and safely. Whether it’s a jobsite or your driveway, you’ll appreciate being able to work exactly where you need to. This is a contractor grade miter saw stand, but priced for the homeowner. But don’t let the low cost fool you – this is a high quality piece of equipment, with tubular steel construction, and a whopping 500lb capacity, so you can handle the big jobs with ease. The quick attach mounts make attaching and detaching the saw simple, and the adjustable 13” tall material supports can be in or out to support material ten feet long. But here’s the kicker – it’s not only lightweight, but it folds up for easy transport and storage, making this one of the most versatile miter saw stands on the market. An optional Wheel Kit is available (PM-7004) for added mobility, and extra tool mounts (PM-7002 – 20-in long and can be adjusted along the width to fit most saws) are also available allowing you to expand the use of your stand to other tools in your shop.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
If you have any questions about our product, please contact us by emailing info@affinitytool.com or calling 1-866-588-0395.
feature_bullets: A cut above - The Bora Portamate PM-4000 is the best, most practical, hassle-free stand you’ll find for miter saws or chop saws. Constructed of tubular steel with a powder-coated finish, This rugged yet lightweight saw stand can support up to 500 lbs. And is compatible with Miter saws up to 12 inches, including compound sliding saws.

Cut out for convenience - setup is quick and simple, as the folding legs swing Under the center portion and are secured by pins that snap into position. Stand folds up for easy transport, storage and carrying from your vehicle to the worksite. Folded size is 43. 5" W x 20" D x 6. 5" H and Weighs only 30 lbs. Without a saw.

Switch gears & mount add tools - quick-attach saw mounts allow for easy mounting of your saw, as well as other tools which you can switch around, set up and take down quickly – hardware is included. Additional mount sets sold separately offer a wider variety of tools that you can use with your PM-4000 stand.

Makes the cut – our PM-4000 saw stand was specially designed to provide the ideal ergonomic working height of 36 inches, so professional contractors and day's can work safely and comfortably while making cuts with absolute precision and secure stability.
Any way you cut it – Buy with confidence knowing that you are backed by our 1-year . If for any reason, you're not 100% satisfied with your purchase, let US know, and we'll make it right.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,095 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
